how is my argument bad?
Even before lethality ARMOR PEN RUNES were known to be bad in early game and better in mid game

buffing lethality % won't make suddenly armor pen runes broken from level 1 to 7, it will make them better in mid game which is what the buff is doing, it will make them better in early game since it gives more armor pen **but armor pen runes will always be inferior to ad runes in early game thus the buff doesn't affect them a lot in early levels**

The buffed Lethality is now on par with armor pen runes in the early and mid game. 24 lethal and 8.5 from mastery gives you 33 rounding up. That is 18 armor pen at level 1. Old armor pen runes gives you 19 armor pen and 3 from old Precision. 22 at level one. 

Lets assume you're level 8 and bought Ghost Blade. At level 8 you have 77.7% of your total lethality. Your total would be around 55.

W/Ghostblade
Old armor pen = 42
Current Lethality = 42.7

You're already matching the old armor pen and gaining so much more through other items as you continue to scale with current lethality.

Lets even assume you're level 4 with the same runes and masteries but with Dirk. 44 Lethal total. 

W/Dirk
Old armor pen = 32
Current Lethality = 30

The difference of the old armor pen and new is very minor in the early game but got a giant buff in the mid to late game. Allowing you to essentially deal true damage to any carries. If you want some fun, play Garen with the said lethal runes and mastery and rush Ghostblade and Blackcleaver. Anybody with less than 127 armor will be dealt true damage. You can then build tank afterwards. 

The only reason AD runes would be chosen at all right now would be because of easier time for farming. That's practically it.

> 
> When you start with 60%, you get 2.2% of it back per level (2.2% x 18 = 39.6. Again, very tiny amount to be off by, but the math is sound)
> 
> Let's compare at levels 6, 11, and 16.
> 
> 40%: 40% + (3.3 x 6) = 59.8% effectiveness. If you had 20 Lethality, you would be getting 11.96 Armor pen out of it.
> 60%: 60% + (2.2 x 6) = 73.2% effectiveness. With 20 Lethality, that's 14.64 Armor Pen. A whopping difference of 2.68 Armor Pen.
> 
> 40% + (3.3 x 11) = 76.3%, or 15.26 out of your 20 Lethality
> 60% + (2.2 x 11) = 84.2%, or 16.84 out of 20 Lethality.
> 
> 40%: 40% + (3.3 x 16) = 92.8%, or 18.56 out of 20 Lethality
> 60%: 60% + (2.2 x 16) = 95.2%, or 19.04 out of 20 Lethality
